intro: Cacalia floridana, commonly known as the Florida cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cacalia floridana is a relatively rare species, and its conservation status is of interest to botanists and ecologists.
